subject: Ethics
title: The Right to Housing
description: A quick, practical guide to The Right to Housing.

hook.text: In 2023 a Finnish city announced it had nearly eliminated homelessness. Most countries hadn't even tried.

buildup.text: Finland's Housing First model gives people homes before tackling addiction or employmentâ€”reversing the usual order.

discovery.text: The results shocked skeptics: stable housing actually reduced costs because emergency visits plummeted.

twist.text: Critics argue housing markets depend on scarcity, so guaranteeing shelter threatens property values.

climax.text: The question isn't whether we can house everyoneâ€”it's whether we believe shelter is a right or a reward.

punchline.text: A roof shouldn't depend on whether the market finds you profitable.

quiz.question: What is distinctive about Finland's Housing First approach?
options: It requires people to find jobs before receiving housing
It provides homes before addressing other issues like addiction
It builds housing only in rural areas
